term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - mass distribution ratio
term.title: mass distribution ratio

item.text: Defined as: kMEKC = nmc/naq = K.(Vmc/Vaq) and naq are the chemical amounts of the analyte in the micellar and aqueous phases, respectively, K is the distribution constant and V mc and Vaq are the corresponding volumes of the phases.

notes.item: In the case of an electrically neutral analyte, kMEKC can be calculated directly from the migration times: kMEKC = (tm - teo)/(teo(1 - tm/tmc))
kMEKC should not be confused with the retention factor (in column chromatography) k. However, kMEKC is analogous to the mass distribution ratio (in chromatography).

item.meaning: Mass distribution ratio (in micellar electrokinetic chromatography)
Mass distribution ratio (in micellar electrokinetic chromatography)
